laboratory_examinations.findings: There is a small left pleural effusion associated with atelectasis. Trace right pleural effusion with associated atelectasis. Heart size is enlarged. No suspicious focal lesion in the liver. Punctate nonobstructing stone within the gallbladder. There are mild atrophic changes of the pancreas at the head. Bilateral kidneys are atrophic. Cystic lesion of the inferior pole right kidney likely a simple cyst. Small amount of free fluid adjacent to the bowel at the ostomy. Small collection adjacent to the rectal pouch measuring 3.8 x 2.5 cm with an air-fluid level. Small amount of free air underlying the midline incision. Coarse calcifications within a nonenlarged prostate. No lymphadenopathy. Mild-to-moderate atherosclerotic calcification of the abdominal aorta.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: There is a small collection adjacent to the rectal pouch measuring 3.8 x 2.5 cm with an air-fluid level, unchanged from a previous examination.
